meanings.definition: The ability to last or endure over time.
meanings.sent1: The durabilities of the ancient ruins amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The durabilities of the steel beams ensured the stability of the bridge.
meanings.sent3: Despite their small size, the tiny turtles showed remarkable durabilities in their journey.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship had the durabilities of a sturdy oak tree, weathering all storms.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape fluttered in the wind, symbolizing the durabilities of justice.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to withstand wear, pressure, or damage.
meanings.sent1: The durabilities of the new phone case protected the device from cracks.
meanings.sent2: The durabilities of the armor shielded the knight from enemy attacks.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret recipe had the surprising durabilities to resist spoiling.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse stood tall, showcasing its durabilities against the raging sea.
meanings.sent5: The diamond's sparkle was a testament to its durabilities against scratches.
